publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3096 John Scott: Burns and a' that Festival—That the Parliament congratulates Ayrshire and Arran Tourist Board and its Chief Executive Janet Reuben on the resounding success of the first "Burns and a’ that" festival which was held in Ayrshire between 27 April and 5 May 2002; further welcomes the role played in the festival’s success by its backers, including South Ayrshire Council, Scottish Enterprise Ayrshire, the Scottish Executive, the Scottish Arts Council, VisitScotland, the National Trust for Scotland and the festival producers, Unique Events, and looks forward to the continued growth and development of the festival next year and in further years to come.

S1M-3096 John Scott: Burns and a' that Festival-That the Parliament congratulates Ayrshire and Arran Tourist Board and its Chief Executive Janet Reuben on the resounding success of the first "Burns and a' that" festival which was held in Ayrshire between 27 April and 5 May 2002; further welcomes the role played in the festival's success by its backers, including South Ayrshire Council, Scottish Enterprise Ayrshire, the Scottish Executive, the Scottish Arts Council, VisitScotland, the National Trust for Scotland and the festival producers, Unique Events, and looks forward to the continued growth and development of the festival next year and in further years to come.
S1M-3096 Burns and a' that Festival (lodged on 9 May 2002) Phil Gallie*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Tommy Sheridan*, Michael Russell*
S1M-3096 Burns and a' that Festival (lodged on 9 May 2002) Mr Murray Tosh*
S1M-3096 Burns and a' that Festival (lodged on 9 May 2002) Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-3096 Burns and a' that Festival (lodged on 9 May 2002) Mr Duncan Hamilton*, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-3096 Burns and a' that Festival (lodged on 9 May 2002) Christine Grahame*
